member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND
member.summary: This structure is used as an input buffer when using the pass-through mechanism to issue a vendor-specific command to a storage device (via IOCTL_STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND).

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.Version
member.summary: The version of this structure. This should be set to STORAGE_PROTOCOL_STRUCTURE_VERSION.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.Length
member.summary: The size of this structure. This should be set to sizeof(STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND).

summary.para: Flags set for this request. The following are valid flags.

listheader.description: This flag indicates the request to target an adapter instead of device.

summary.para: The status of the request made to the storage device. In Windows 10, possible values include:

listheader.description: The request has encountered an error.
A device is not available to make a request to.
The device is busy acting on the request.
The device encountered a data overrun while acting on the request.
The device cannot complete the request due to insufficient resources.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.ErrorCode
member.summary: The error code for this request. This is optionally set.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.CommandLength
member.summary: The length of the command. A non-zero value must be set by the caller.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.ErrorInfoLength
member.summary: The length of the error buffer. This is optionally set and can be set to 0.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.DataToDeviceTransferLength
member.summary: The size of the buffer that is to be transferred to the device. This is only used with a WRITE request.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.DataFromDeviceTransferLength
member.summary: The size of the buffer this is to be transferred from the device. This is only used with a READ request.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.TimeOutValue
member.summary: How long to wait for the device until timing out. This is set in units of seconds.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.ErrorInfoOffset
member.summary: The offset of the error buffer. This must be pointer-aligned.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.DataToDeviceBufferOffset
member.summary: The offset of the buffer that is to be transferred to the device. This must be pointer-aligned and is only used with a WRITE request.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.DataFromDeviceBufferOffset
member.summary: The offset of the buffer that is to be transferred from the device. This must be pointer-aligned and is only used with a READ request.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.CommandSpecific
member.summary: Command-specific data passed along with the command. This depends on the command from the driver, and is optionally set.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.FixedProtocolReturnData
member.summary: The return data. This is optionally set. Some protocols such as NVMe, may return a small amount of data (DWORD0 from completion queue entry) without the need of a separate device data transfer.

member.name: STORAGE_PROTOCOL_COMMAND.Command
member.summary: The vendor-specific command that is to be passed-through to the device.
